intro: Villocuspis elegans, commonly known as the velvet tailed rat plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a velvety texture, giving it its common name. It is often grown as a decorative plant in tropical and subtropical regions due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
